units.name: Divide and Conquer Approach
topics: sets and disjoint sets: Union and Find algorithms

units.name: Greedy Algorithms
topics: Minimum Spanning trees: Prim's algorithm and Kruskal's algorithm

units.name: Graph Algorithms
topics: single source shortest paths: Bellmen-Ford algorithm
All pairs shortest path: The Warshall's algorithm

units.name: Dynamic Programming and Backtracking
topics: Overview, difference between dynamic programming and divide and conquer
Traveling salesman Problem, longest Common sequence

units.name: Branch Bound and Computational Complexity
topics: LC searching Bounding, FIFO branch and bound
LC branch and bound application: 0/1 Knapsack problem

books.name: Fundamentals of Computer Algorithms by E. Horowitz and S. Sahni, Galgotia
Introduction to Algorithms by Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest and Clifford Stein, MIT Press, Cambridge

units.name: Basic Concepts
topics: Introduction to File and Database systems- Database system structure -concepts and architecture, date models
database languages & interfaces, Data Model, ER model

units.name: Relational Models
topics: SQL - Data definition- Queries in SQL-relational model concepts
SQL- a relational database language: date definition in SQL
specifying constraints and indexes in SQL; relational database management systems-Updates
Views, Integrity and Security, Relational Database design
Functional dependences and Normalization for Relational Databases
normal forms based on primary keys
lossless join and dependency preserving decomposition

units.name: Data Storage and query Processing
topics: Record storage and Primary file organization- Secondary storage Devices
Different types of Indexes- B-Tree - B+Tree

units.name: Transaction Management
topics: Need for Concurrency control, Desirable properties of Transaction

units.name: Current Trends
topics: Introduction to Distributed and parallel databases

books.name: Database System Concepts by Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth and S. Sudarshan, McGraw-Hill
Fundamental Database Systems by Ramez Elmasri and Shamkant B. Navathe, Pearson Education

units.name: Introduction to Compilers
topics: Compiler and translators need of translators
syntax Analysis. Basic Parsing Techniques: Parsers shift-reduce parsing

units.name: Automatic Construction of Efficient Parsers
topics: LR parsers, canonical collection of LR(0) items
construction LALR and SLR parsing tables using ambiguous grammars

units.name: Syntax-Directed Translation
topics: intermediate code, postfix notation parse trees and syntax trees
three address code, quadruples and triples
postfix translation with top down parser

units.name: Symbol Tables
topics: Contents of a table, data structures for symbol tables

units.name: Introduction to Code optimization
topics: value numbers and algebraic laws, global data flow analysis

books.name: Compilers Principles, Techniques and Tools by Alfred V. Aho, Monica S. Lam, Ravi Sethi and Jeffrey D Ullman, Pearson Education
Compiler Design in C by Allen I. Holub, Prentice Hall of India

units.name: Raster Scan Graphics
topics: LR parsers, canonical collection of LR(0) items
construction LALR and SLR parsing tables using ambiguous grammars

units.name: Two-Dimensional Geometric Transformation & Viewing
topics: Points, lines, circles and ellipses as primitives
Fill area primitives including scan-line polygon filling

units.name: Visible Lines and Visible Surfaces
topics: : Visual Realism, Hidden line and hidden surface removal: depth buffer algorithm, geometric computations
illumination methods (ambient, diffuse reflection, specular reflection)
Color models: properties of light, XYZ, RGB, YIQ and CMY color models

books.name: Procedural Elements for Computer Graphics by D.F. Rogers, McGraw Hill
Mathematical Elements for Computer Graphics by D.F. Rogers, McGraw Hil

Development of Online Course Portal for the Campus
Student Attendance Management System

courses.name: Compiler Design Lab
experiments: Write a C/C++ program to search the number of occurrences of any word
string and sub sequence in a given string
Write a C/C++ program to find the number of occurrences of any word in a file and replace that with another word
Implement the lexical analyzer using JLex, Flex or other lexical analyzer generating tools and write the following program using LEX
Program to count the number of characters, words, spaces and lines in a given input file
Program to count the number of comment lines in a given C program. Also eliminate them and copy the resulting program into separate file
Program to recognize a valid arithmetic expression and to recognize the identifiers and operators present
Print them separately
Program to recognize and count the number of identifiers in a given input file
Write a program to check whether a string belongs to the grammar or not. Write a program to generate a parse tree
Write a program to check whether a grammar is left recursive and left factoring
Write a program to remove left recursion and left factoring
Write a program to implementation FIRST and FOLLOW for the given grammar
Write a program to implementation to implement recursive-Descent and Non-recursive Predictive parser
Write a program to check whether a given grammar is LL (1) or not
Write a C/C+ + program to implementation of shift reduce parsing Algorithm

Write a C/C++ program to construct i) LR Parsing table and Implement LR parsing algorithm, ii) CLR Parsing table and implement CLR parsing algorithm, iii) LALR Parsing table and implement LALR parsing algorithm
YACC program to recognize i) a valid arithmetic expression that uses operators +, -,* and /, ii) strings 'aabb','abbb', 'ab' and 'a' using the grammar
Write a C program to implement i) the syntax-directed definition of “if E then S1” and “if E then S1 else S2”, ii) a Symbol Table with function to create, insert, modify, search and display

courses.name: Computer Graphics Lab
experiments: Program to implement DDA algorithms for line
Program to implement Bresenham's algorithms for line, circle and ellipse drawing
Program to implement Mid Point Circle algorithm
Program to implement Mid Point Ellipse algorithm
Program to perform 2D Transformations such as translation, rotation, scaling, reflection and sharing
Program to implement Cohen-Sutherland 2D clipping and window-viewport mapping
Program to implement Liang Barsky Line Clipping Algorithm
Program to perform 3D Transformations such as translation, rotation and scaling
Program for conversion between color models
Program to perform animation using any Animation software
Program to perform basic operations on image using any image editing software
Program to draw different shapes such as hut, face, kite, fish etc

Write a program to implementation to implement recursive-Descent and Non-recursive Predictive parser
Write a program to check whether a given grammar is LL (1) or not
Write a C/C+ + program to implementation of shift reduce parsing Algorithm

Write a C/C++ program to construct i) LR Parsing table and Implement LR parsing algorithm, ii) CLR Parsing table and implement CLR parsing algorithm, iii) LALR Parsing table and implement LALR parsing algorithm
YACC program to recognize i) a valid arithmetic expression that uses operators +, -,* and /, ii) strings 'aabb','abbb', 'ab' and 'a' using the grammar
Write a C program to implement i) the syntax-directed definition of “if E then S1” and “if E then S1 else S2”, ii) a Symbol Table with function to create, insert, modify, search and display

experiments: Program to implement DDA algorithms for line
